cyclone.name: MICHAEL
cyclone.current_location: about 180 miles SSW of Panama City, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving north across the NE Gulf, then accelerating northeast across Georgia–Carolinas and turning east-northeast off the Mid-Atlantic before racing out over the western Atlantic south of New England
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Panhandle near Panama City / Big Bend

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch from South Santee River SC to Duck NC, including Pamlico and Albemarle Sounds
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning north of Fernandina Beach FL to South Santee River SC; Hurricane Warning Alabama/Florida border to Suwannee River FL; Storm Surge Warning Okaloosa/Walton Co. Line FL to Anclote River FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Panhandle, southeast Alabama–Georgia, Carolinas, coastal Mid-Atlantic, and offshore waters south of New England
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤5%) chance of tropical-storm-force gusts late Friday night into early Saturday; otherwise breezy conditions 20–30 kt possible as the system passes well SE of Cape Cod.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for Boston; surge threat confined to FL Gulf Coast.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches possible across southern New England with locally higher pockets, leading to brief urban/poor-drainage flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Very rough seas and dangerous rip currents along the Massachusetts outer coastal waters Friday–Saturday could disrupt pilot transfers and light-draft operations.
